definitions.text: (logic) what is predicated of the subject of a proposition; the second term in a proposition is predicated of the first term by means of the copula
examples: `Socrates is a man' predicates manhood of Socrates

definitions.text: one of the two main constituents of a sentence; the predicate contains the verb and its complements
make the (grammatical) predicate in a proposition
examples: The predicate `dog' is predicated of the subject `Fido' in the sentence `Fido is a dog'

definitions.text: affirm or declare as an attribute or quality of
examples: The speech predicated the fitness of the candidate to be President

definitions.text: involve as a necessary condition of consequence; as in logic
examples: solving the problem is predicated on understanding it well
